In which stage of Demographic cycle is India currently?
questions.solution: In India, the death rate is decreasing due to better medical facilities nowadays and the birth rate is also on declining stage due to proper awareness and usage of contraception methods like oral pills and condoms. But the overall birth rate is still higher than the death rate, hence population continuous to grow. Hence, India is in the late expanding stage.

questions.text: For a population of 10000, sex ratio of more than 1000 means
questions.solution: Sex ratio is defined as the number of females per 1000 males. According to 2011 Census, sex ratio in India is 940, which means 940 females per 1000 males in India. Although it is an upward trend as compared to 2001 census where sex ratio was 933. But it is still a matter of concern as female foeticide is still very prevalent. Although there are some states like Kerala and Union Territory like Puducherry in India have sex ratio in which females are more than males. Kerala has a number of 1084 females to that of 1000 males.

questions.text: What is used as emergency contraceptive?
questions.solution:
Emergency contraceptive methods are as follows

  1. Yuzpe and Lancee method (Using OCPs)
  2. Mini pills (LNG)
  3. High dose estrogen
  4. Antiprogestogen(Mifepristone RU 486)
  5. IUD insertion

questions.text: Which test use whole blood as sample in detection of TB
questions.solution: Interferon gamma release assays (IGRAs) are blood-based tests intended for diagnosis of latent tuberculosis infection (LTBI). IGRAs offer logistical advantages and are supposed to offer improved specificity over the tuberculin skin test (TST).

questions.text: Epidemic dropsy caused by
questions.solution:
Epidemic dropsy is a clinical state resulting from use of edible oils adulterated with Argemone mexicana oil.

Sanguinarine and dehydrosanguinarine are two major toxic alkaloids of Argemone oil

It cause widespread capillary dilatation, proliferation and increased capillary permeability, Leakage of the protein-rich plasma component into the extracellular compartment leads to the formation of oedema.

questions.solution:

questions.text: A patient was admitted to a government hospital with and microscopically confirmed Plasmodium falciparum infection. Which one of the following treatments is indicated?
questions.solution: Artemisinin Combination Therapy (ACT) should be given to all the confirmed P. falciparum cases found positive by microscopy or RDT. This is to be accompanied by single dose of primaquine (0.75 mg/kg body weight) on Day 2. The ACT recommended in the National Program all over India (except in northeastern states) is artesunate (4 mg/kg body weight) daily for 3 days and sulfadoxine (25 mg/kg body weight) -pyrimethamine (1.25 mg/kg body weight) [AS+SP] on Day 0. For north eastern states recommended ACT in national drug policy is fixed dose combination (FDC) of Artemether-lumefantrine (AL)

questions.text: New TB Definitions.
questions.solution:
NEW definitions in TB control

Recurrent TB case-A TB patient previously declared as successfully treated (cured/treatment completed) and who is subsequently found to be microbiologically confirmed TB case is a recurrent TB case. (Previously called relapse.)

Treatment after loss to follow-up-A TB patient previously treated for TB for one month or more and who was declared lost to follow-up in their most recent course of treatment and subsequently found microbiologically confirmed TB cases. (Previously called treatment after default)

questions.text: All the following are quantitative variables except
questions.solution:
Variables are classified as

  1. Qualitative/Categorical variable
  2. Quantitative variable

Qualitative subclassified into again three

  • Nominal (denoting names)- eg: gender,blood group
  • Ordinal (having order) eg: APGAR score, TNM staging
  • Binomial (two outcomes) eg: no of failures/successes, dead/alive

Quantitative subclassified into two

  • Continuous variable (having decimals)- height, weight, temperature scales
  • Discrete variable (only whole numbers)- No.of children, no: of states in a country

choices.text: Broad at base and narrow at apex
Broad at apex and narrow at base

questions.text: Age pyramid of India is
questions.solution: A population pyramid illustrates the age and sex structure of a country's population The population is distributed along the horizontal axis, with males shown on the left and females on the right. The male and female populations are broken down into 5-year age groups represented as horizontal bars along the vertical axis, with the youngest age groups at the bottom and the oldest at the top. For developing countries since fertility rate and mortality rates are more, the base will be broader and apex will be narrow

questions.text: The number of live births per 1000 women in the reproductive age group in a year refers to
questions.solution:
General fertility rate(GFR)

  • The number of live births per 1000 women in the reproductive age group (15-44 or 49 years) in a year

questions.solution:
IFA tablets for 6-10 years is PINK in colour

IFA tablets for 10-19 years is BLUE in colour

questions.text: Which of the following is not coming under 7 cleans
questions.solution:
The Seven Cleans observed during child birth to eliminate neonatal tetanus are

  1. Clean birth site - preventing delivery onto the floor
  2. Clean hands - to prevent the birth attendant transmitting germs to mother and baby
  3. Clean ties - to prevent bleeding and infection to umbilical cord
  4. Clean cut/razor - to reduce infection caused by other implements
  5. Clean stump - to avoid applying things that can cause sepsis like cow dung, mud, ashes
  6. Clean water
  7. Clean towel

choices.text: Net sensitivity is increased and Net specificity is decreased
Net sensitivity is decreased and Net specificity is increased
Net sensitivity remains the same and Net specificity is increased

questions.text: A Hemoccult test with sensitivity of 70% and specificity of 75% is applied for detecting Colon cancer. If Hemoccult test is negative, no further testing is done. If test is positive the individual will have a second sample tested with Hemoccult II test. If second sample also tests positive for blood, they will be referred for more extensive evaluation. The effect on net sensitivity and specificity of this method of screening is
questions.solution:
• Testing in Series/ Sequential/two stage testing
    • A Population subjected to one screening test followed by a second screening test
    • Second test applied to those whom test positive on 1 st test
  • Testing in Parallel.
    • Also called Simultaneous testing
    • A Population subjected two(more)screening tests at the same time
    • Each of the individual subjected to all tests

questions.text: For a 60kg Indian male, minimum daily protein requirement has been calculated to be 40gm ± 10 (SD). RDA of protein would be
questions.solution:
The recommended dietary allowance (RDA) is the average daily dietary intake level that suffices to meet the nutrient requirements of nearly all (97-98%) healthy persons of a specific sex, age, life stage, or physiological condition (such as pregnancy or lactation).

RDA is defined as two standard deviations above the average requirement, assuming that the distribution of nutrient requirements is normal

So RDA is Mean+2 SD for all nutrients except for energy

questions.text: The highest percentages of poly unsaturated fatty acids are present in
questions.solution:
Polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) are fatty acids that contain more than one double bond in their backbone. Omega-3 PUFAs are perceived as a beneficial dietary intervention for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease (CVD).

Following is the PUFA concentration in various oils :

Hemp oil (79%)> Safflower oil(77%)> Sunflower Oil(69%)> Walnut oil(66%)> Soyabean Oil(61%)> Margarine(33%)> Ground nut oil(32%)> Mustard oil(31%)> Olive oil(11%)> Palm oil(10%)> Butter(4%)> Coconut oil

questions.text: Most common cause of infant mortality in India is
questions.solution: Most common cause of infant mortality in India is Low Birth weight and Prematurity

questions.text: The protective effects of breast milk are known to be associated with
questions.solution: The breast milk contains proteins like casein, α-lactalbumin, lactoferrin, secretory immunoglobulin IgA, lysozyme, and serum albumin. Human milk contains a variety of cells, including macrophages, T cells, stem cells, and lymphocytes

questions.text: James Lind is known for
questions.solution:
• James Lind was a Navy doctor. His experiment to find cause behind scurvy is considered as the first clinical trial conducted

He divided the 12 sick sailors with an unknown sickness (later found to be survey) into six pairs, and provided each of them with a different supplement in their diet: cider, vitriolic elixir (diluted sulfuric acid), vinegar, sea water, two oranges and a lemon, or a purgative mixture. Following this experiment two sailors who took the fruit recovered from survey

choices.text: Unequal distribution of prognostic factors between arms

questions.text: Randomization is useful to eliminate
questions.solution:
Uses of randomization:

  • Helps to eliminate selection bias
  • Makes treatment and control arm comparable in terms of prognostic factors and confounders

questions.text: Isolation period should be
questions.solution:
• Isolation →

Separation for period of communicability of infected persons or animals from others in such places and conditions to prevent transmission of infectious agent from those infected to those susceptible

  • Quarantine →

Restriction of movement of apparently healthy people who have been exposed to a case of communicable disease for a period equivalent to longest IP of the disease

questions.text: NPU value for egg is
questions.solution:
The protein requirement varies with the NPU of dietary protein. If NPU is high, the protein requirement is low and vice versa. Highest NPU is for egg

NPU egg-96

NPU milk-81

Meat-79

Fish-77
